content.description: Starting from the corner/the finish of "Running Through the Six," "With My Woes" continues towards climbers right. Make a delicate move from the corner to the next sill using a mono pocket (tssssssaah) at head hight. The majority of the route offers a great view into the lecture of the day in Hedge 104. When you reach the bike rack, make a move similar to the start with more spice and less mono pocket.
content.location: To the right of "Running Through the Six" from the corner to the bike rack.

content.description: Lowball sit start, tsssaah, high foot, lay back, hit the jug, peak in the window, victory whipper
content.location: Find the north-west face of Hedge, climb the right side of the right most filled in window sill

content.description: Start is the lower windowsill, going left to grab the next brick edge. Stand up on a high right foot to top out on the high window ledge.
content.protection: one pad and a friend to be a look out
content.location: Just to the left of Shawn Kingston, finish on the same ledge

content.description: Granite window sills, brick side pulls, visible from public walkways for maximum confusion of the average Joe. Keep feet on one of the two granite block horizontal buttresses. Best if linked "With My Woes" by finessing around the corner.
content.location: Find the north-west face of the building. This route traverses the three filled in window sills all the way to the corner at climbers right.

content.description: The majority of the routes are on the north-west and south-east faces of this building. High quality granite window sills, brick crimps, choosy mortar and the occasional mono pocket make Hedge top notch. 10 out of 10 would recommend
